comment.author: 39191857@N05
comment._content: The one day in I did not get a chance to look at the NLI stream and what comes up?  The place where I played as a boy and that lives in my dreams comes up and I miss it and the man who knows Blackpool beach gets the prize;-(((((. I feel sick, I resign, I give up. Hope you have something interesting on Monday Carol.

comment.author: 39191857@N05
comment._content: Carrigogunnell was part of the outer defences for Limerick with a dramatic view of the Shannon.  Around the time of the sieges of Limerick it too was. Esieged and the conquerors blew it up so that it could no longer be used.  That explains the dilapidated condition.

comment.author: 16489083@N05

Marvelous vintage photo and wonderful as 
always sleuth work on the ID... way to go!!!!
comment.authorname: maorlando God kept us 2012 leaning on Him 2013

comment.author: 34842055@N00
comment._content: I get up early like Dad and go on long walks into the country.I walk around the graveyard in the old abbey at Mungret where my mother's relations are buried and I go up the boreen to the Norman castle at Carrigogunnell where Dad brought me twice. I climb to the top and Ireland is spread out before me, the Shannon shining its way to the Atlantic. Frank McCourt
